info.title: ThingSpace Cloud Connector for Azure
info.description: The ThingSpace Cloud Connector API lets customers securely stream data from devices on ThingSpace to remote servers or to accounts hosted by trusted cloud service providers.

post.description: Search for targets by property values. Returns an array of all matching target resources.

requestBody.description: Search for targets by property values.

200.description: A success response includes an array of all matching targets. Each target includes the full target resource definition.

post.description: Remove a target from a ThingSpace account.

requestBody.description: The request body identifies the target to delete.

post.description: Define a target to receive data streams, alerts, or callbacks. After creating the target resource, use its ID in a subscription to set up a data stream.

requestBody.description: The request body provides the details of the target that you want to create.

200.description: A success response includes the full target resource definition.

post.description: Create a unique string that ThingSpace will pass to AWS for increased security.

requestBody.description: The request body only contains the authenticating account.

post.description: Create a subscription to define a streaming channel that sends data from devices in the account to an endpoint defined in a target resource.

requestBody.description: The request body provides the details of the subscription that you want to create.

post.description: Search for subscriptions by property values. Returns an array of all matching subscription resources.

requestBody.description: The request body specifies fields and values to match.

200.description: Returns an array of all matching subscriptions. Each subscription includes the full subscription resource definition.

post.description: Remove a subscription from a ThingSpace account.

requestBody.description: The request body identifies the subscription to delete.

post.description: Change configuration values on a device, such as setting how often a device records and reports sensor readings.

requestBody.description: The request body changes configuration values on a device.

200.description: A success response contains the ts.event.configuration event that was created to record the change.

post.description: Find devices by property values. Returns an array of all matching device resources.

requestBody.description: The request body specifies fields and values to match.

200.description: A success response includes an array of all matching devices. Each device includes the full device resource definition.

post.description: Search for devices by property values. Returns an array of all matching device resources.

requestBody.description: The request body specifies fields and values to match.

200.description: A success response includes an array of all matching devices.

post.description: Search device event history to find events that match criteria.Sensor readings, configuration changes, and other device data are all stored as events.

requestBody.description: The device identifier and fields to match in the search.

200.description: A success response includes an array of all matching devices.

post.description: Returns the readings of a specified sensor, with the most recent reading first. Sensor readings are stored as events; this request an array of events.

requestBody.description: The device identifier and fields to match in the search.

200.description: A success response includes an array of all matching devices.

post.description: Remove a device from a ThingSpace account.

requestBody.description: The request body identifies the device to delete.

post.description: Deploy a new Azure IoT Central application based on the Verizon ARM template within the specified Azure Active Directory account.

parameters.name: BillingaccountID
parameters.description: TThe ThingSpace ID of the authenticating billing account.

requestBody.description: The request body must include the UUID of the subscription that you want to update plus any properties that you want to change.

200.description: A success response includes the full subscription resource definition.

QueryASubscriptionResponse.description: An array of all matching subscriptions.

configurationfailures.description: The number of streaming failures due to faulty configuration.

createdon.description: The number of streaming failures due to faulty configuration.

disabled.description: Whether the subscription is currently sending data.

email.description: The address to which any error reports should be delivered.

id.description: ThingSpace unique ID for the subscription that was created.

laststreamingtime.description: The date and time that the last stream send was attempted.

lastupdated.description: The date the resource was last updated.

networkfailures.description: The number of failures due to network problems.

streamkind.description: The event type that will be sent in the data stream.

targetid.description: Target to be used for dispatching events.

version.description: Version of the underlying schema resource.

createdon.description: The date the resource was created.

id.description: ThingSpace unique ID for the target that was created.

kind.description: Identifies the resource kind. Targets are ts.target.

lastupdated.description: The date the resource was last updated.

version.description: Version of the underlying schema resource.

QueryATargetResponse.description: An array of all matching targets.

QueryTargetRequest.description: Search for targets by property values.

AccountIdentifier.description: The ID of the authenticating billing account, in the format `{"billingaccountid":"1234567890-12345"}`.

ResourceIdentifier.description: The ID of the target to delete, in the format {"id": "dd1682d3-2d80-cefc-f3ee-25154800beff"}.

CreateTargetRequest.description: Details of the target that you want to create.

billingaccountid.description: The ID of the authenticating billing account.

kind.description: Identifies the resource kind. Targets are ts.target.

address.description:
The endpoint for notifications or data streams. The format depends on the selected `addressscheme`.
`streamrest` requires a `host:port` value
`streamawsiot` requres a valid ARN.

addressscheme.description:
The transport format. Valid values are:
streamawsiot - streamed data to an AWS account
streamrest - streamed REST data to a defined endpoint.

externalid.description: Security identification string created by a POST /targets/actions/newextid request.

TargetAuthentication.description: OAuth 2 token and refresh token for TS to stream events to Target.

CreateSubscriptionRequest.description: The details of the subscription that you want to create.

disabled.description: Enable or disable the subscription. A disabled subscription will not send any data.

email.description: The address to which any error reports should be delivered.

filter.description: String containing a $filter object with a property and value to filter out non-matching events.

streamkind.description: The type of event data to send via this subscription. This will be `ts.event` in most cases. Other event types are `ts.event.diagnostics` for device diagnostic data, `ts.event.configuration` for device configuration events, or `ts.event.security`. Note that the device ThingSpace client must support sending specific event types for anything other than `ts.event`.

targetid.description: The ID of the target resource to be used when dispatching events. The corresponding target should have a stream addressscheme.

allowaggregation.description: Setting this value to `false` prevents the data returned from being aggregated and makes the data easier to parse.

example.targetid: your target ID UUID such as ae110c40-2685-6c70-f46e-286f7370b8a9
example.name: name your subscription

Selection.description: A comma-separated list of properties and comparator values to match against subscriptions in the ThingSpace account. See Working with Query Filters for more information. If the request does not include `$selection`, the response will include all subscriptions to which the requesting user has access.

ChangeConfigurationRequest.description: The request body identifies the device and the values to set.

configuration.description: List of the field names and values to set.

action.description: The action requested in this event; change for device configuration changes.

createdon.description: The date and time of the change request.

fields.description: List of fields affected by the event.

id.description: The unique ID of this ts.event.configuration event.

kind.description: The kind of the ThingSpace resource that is being reported

lastupdated.description: The date and time that the event was last updated.

name.description: The name of the event; SetConfigurationReq for device configuration changes.

state.description: The current status of the request. The value will be pending until the device wakes up and ThingSpace can send the request to the device.

billingaccountid.description: Billing account ID of the resource.

createdon.description: The date the resource was created.

id.description: ThingSpace unique ID for the device that was added.

lastupdated.description: The date the resource was last updated.

refid.description: The value of the refidtype identifier.

refidtype.description: The device identifier type used to refer to this device.

version.description: Version of the underlying schema resource.

FindDeviceByPropertyResponseList.description: A success response includes an array of all matching devices. Each device includes the full device resource definition.

SearchDeviceByPropertyResponseList.description: A success response includes an array of all matching devices.

SearchDeviceByPropertyResponse.description: The device identifier and fields to match in the search.

billingaccountid.description: Billing account ID of the resource.

createdon.description: The date the resource was created.

id.description: ThingSpace unique ID for the device that was added.

lastupdated.description: The date the resource was last updated.

refid.description: The value of the refidtype identifier.

refidtype.description: The device identifier type used to refer to this device.

version.description: Version of the underlying schema resource.

SearchDeviceByPropertyFields.description: List of device sensors and their most recently reported values.

SearchDeviceEventHistoryRequest.description: Search Device By Property resource definition.

$limitnumber.description: The maximum number of events to include in the response.

$page.description: The maximum number of events to include in the response.

SearchDeviceEventHistoryResponseList.description: A success response includes an array of all matching events.

SearchDeviceResponse.description: A success response includes an array of all matching events. Each event includes the full event resource definition.

action.description: The action requested in this event; change for device configuration changes.

createdon.description: The date and time of the change request.

fields.description: List of fields affected by the event.

id.description: The unique ID of this ts.event.configuration event.

kind.description: The kind of the ThingSpace resource that is being reported; ts.event.configuration for device configuration changes.

lastupdated.description: The date and time that the event was last updated.

state.description: The current status of the request.

tagids.description: UUIDs of tag resources that are applied to this device.

tagid.description: UUID of tag resources that are applied to this device.

SearchSensorHistoryRequest.description: Search Device By Property resource definition.

$limitnumber.description: The maximum number of events to include in the response.

$page.description: The maximum number of events to include in the response.

SearchSensorHistoryResponseList.description: A success response includes an array of all matching events.

RemoveDeviceRequest.description: The request body identifies the device to delete.

CreateIoTApplicationRequest.description: The request body must include the UUID of the subscription that you want to update plus any properties that you want to change.

appName.description: A user defined name for the application being deployed in Azure IoT Central.

billingAccountID.description: The ThingSpace ID of the authenticating billing account

clientID.description: The Azure ClientID of the associated Azure target account

clientSecret.description: The Azure Client Secret of the associated Azure target account

emailIDs.description: The email IDs to be added to/sent to with this API.

resourcegroup.description: The Azure Resource group of the associated Azure target account

sampleIOTcApp.description: This is the reference Azure IoT Central application developed by Verizon.

subscriptionID.description: The Azure Subscription ID of the associated Azure target account

tenantID.description: The Azure Tenant ID of the associated Azure target account

CreateIoTApplicationResponse.description: A success response includes an array of all matching events. Each event includes the full event resource definition.

appName.description: An application will be created under the user's Azure subscription with this name and of type IOT central.

sharedSecret.description: Part of the user credentials (from Azure) the user needs to use for calling further TS Core APIs for setting up Azure cloud connector.

url.description: An IOT central endpoint the user can use to see the data that is being streamed.

VZ-M2M-Token.name: VZ-M2M-Token
VZ-M2M-Token.description: M2M Session Token ([How to generate an M2M session token?]($e/Session%20Management/StartConnectivityManagementSession))
